Package main

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
main.GameEnvironment
public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
The main controller of the game. All interactions with the game should be through this class.
Author:
Andrew Hall and fma107

  • Method Details

    • isValidName

      public boolean isValidName​(java.lang.String name)
      Validates the player's name.
      A player name is valid if:
      - It's between 3-15 (inclusive) characters long
      - It's made up of ONLY alphabetic and space characters (no numbers, punctuation etc.)
      Parameters:
      name - The tested name
      Returns:
      true if the name's valid, false otherwise

    • isValidDuration

      public boolean isValidDuration​(java.lang.String durationString)
      Validates the player's preferred game length
      The game length is valid if:
      - It's an integer - It's between 20-50 (inclusive)
      Parameters:
      durationString - The provided duration
      Returns:
      true if the duration's valid, false otherwise

    • startGame

      public boolean startGame() throws InvalidState
      Starts the game if setup has been completed, placing the player onto the starter island
      Required State: SETUP
      Transitions into: ON_ISLAND
      Returns:
      true if name, ship, and gameLength are set. false otherwise
      Throws:
      InvalidState

    • embark

      public void embark()
      Transitions into an EMBARKING state
      Used to enter the "pick route" screen at port

    • disembark

      public void disembark()
      Transitions back into ON_ISLAND
      Used when backing out of going somewhere

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Transitions into a GAME_OVER state
      Used when... well it's self-explanatory

    • setSail

      public void setSail​(Route route, int wages)
      Transitions the game into a sailing state
      Parameters:
      route - The route we're sailing along

    • getRoute

      public Route getRoute()
      Returns:
      the route

    • repairDamage

      public int repairDamage()
      Deducts the player's money after taking damage
      Returns:
      The cost of repairing the ship

    • passDay

      public RandomEvent passDay()
      Pass a day on the open ocean, paying crew wages and checking for random events
      Returns:
      Any random events that occur, or null

    • piratesTakeCargo

      public boolean piratesTakeCargo()
      Pirates steal all your cargo.
      If they're not satisfied with what they find, transition into a GAME OVER state.
      Returns:
      True if the pirates are satisfied with your cargo (game continues)
      False if the pirates aren't satisfied (walk the plank, game over)

    • setState

      public void setState​(GameState state)
